intro: Stenoseris tenuis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved serissa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, giving it a distinctive appearance. Stenoseris tenuis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
